meanings.definition: To carry or haul something heavy or awkward.
meanings.sent1: She was lugging her backpack up the stairs.
meanings.sent2: The movers were lugging the heavy furniture into the truck.
meanings.sent3: He was lugging the giant watermelon like it was a treasure chest.
meanings.sent4: The old car was lugging itself up the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The little boy was lugging the huge teddy bear around the house.

meanings.definition: To drag or pull something with difficulty.
meanings.sent1: The dog was lugging the leash behind him.
meanings.sent2: She was lugging the broken suitcase through the airport.
meanings.sent3: The cat was lugging the toy mouse around the room in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: The tractor was lugging the heavy load through the muddy field.
meanings.sent5: The child was lugging the wagon full of toys across the yard.
